contextId.information: The word "temptation," an abstract noun, can be expressed as a verb. AT: "Do not let anything tempt us" or "Do not let anything cause us to desire to sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Do not bring us into temptation

contextId.information: These abstract nouns can be translated with verbs. AT: "to the place where you will die ... to the place where you will live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "death" can be translated in a concrete, more detailed way. AT: "to the courts so that the authorities can execute them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

"until he succeeds in bringing my justice and salvation to the people." The meaning of the abstract noun "judgment" can be translated as "just" or "save." AT: "the people know that I am just, and I will save them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "darkness" is an abstract noun. AT: "it became dark over the whole land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: darkness came over the whole land
